com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc

Enum PowerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PowerState>
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.PowerState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PowerState>

    public enum PowerState
extends java.lang.Enum<PowerState>
    The way a block can be powered:
    - ON: Block is powered by something
    - OFF: Power source is nearby but is not powering
    - NONE: No power source nearby

    • Enum Constant Summary

      OFF 
      ON

      • get

        public static PowerState get(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                             org.bukkit.block.BlockFace from,
                             boolean useSignLogic)
        Computes the power state for a given block
        Parameters:
        block - to get the power state of
        from - what BlockFace side the block power should be computed
        useSignLogic - setting, sets whether redstone next to the block acts as power source
        Returns:
        The Power State of the block

      • isSignPowered

        public static boolean isSignPowered(org.bukkit.block.Block signBlock)
        Gets whether a certain sign block is powered by a Redstone power source.
        Parameters:
        signBlock - the block where the sign is located
        Returns:
        True if powered by Redstone

      • isSignPowered

        public static boolean isSignPowered(org.bukkit.block.Block signBlock,
                                    boolean inverted)
        Gets whether a certain sign block is powered by a Redstone power source.
        Parameters:
        signBlock - the block where the sign is located
        inverted - power - True to invert the power as a result, False to get the normal result
        Returns:
        True if powered when not inverted, or not powered and inverted

      • hasPower

        public boolean hasPower()
        Gets whether this Power State is supplying redstone power
        Returns:
        True if power is supplied, False if not
